<ProgramListing>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><Highlight kind="comment">//===-- DependenceAnalysis.cpp - DA Implementation --------------&#42;- C++ -&#42;-===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// DependenceAnalysis is an LLVM pass that analyses dependences between memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// accesses. Currently, it is an (incomplete) implementation of the approach</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// described in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            Practical Dependence Testing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            Goff, Kennedy, Tseng</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            PLDI 1991</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There&#39;s a single entry point that analyzes the dependence between a pair</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of memory references in a function, returning either NULL, for no dependence,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or a more-or-less detailed description of the dependence between them.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Currently, the implementation cannot propagate constraints between</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// coupled RDIV subscripts and lacks a multi-subscript MIV test.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Both of these are conservative weaknesses;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that is, not a source of correctness problems.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since Clang linearizes some array subscripts, the dependence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// analysis is using SCEV-&gt;delinearize to recover the representation of multiple</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// subscripts, and thus avoid the more expensive and less precise MIV tests. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// delinearization is controlled by the flag -da-delinearize.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We should pay some careful attention to the possibility of integer overflow</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the implementation of the various tests. This could happen with Add,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Subtract, or Multiply, with both APInt&#39;s and SCEV&#39;s.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Some non-linear subscript pairs can be handled by the GCD test</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (and perhaps other tests).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Should explore how often these things occur.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Finally, it seems like certain test cases expose weaknesses in the SCEV</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// simplification, especially in the handling of sign and zero extensions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It could be useful to spend time exploring these.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Please note that this is work in progress and the interface is subject to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// change.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;BObj = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b1c5788b85ffa254be0e834edf5cf8f">getUnderlyingObject</a>(LocB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation/#a9550ce4a179e46db37f653ce28feca7a">Ptr</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the underlying objects are the same, they must alias</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (AObj == BObj)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57ac1a99a1af9a4778a61e5cc3e1d622180">AliasResult::MustAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="735"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We may have hit the recursion limit for underlying objects, or have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// underlying objects where we don&#39;t know they will alias.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aed2c5dd2a303159f87771db83f54352b">isIdentifiedObject</a>(AObj) || !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aed2c5dd2a303159f87771db83f54352b">isIdentifiedObject</a>(BObj))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a0916b614598c673c1e6a59c7312a1409">AliasResult::MayAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise we know the objects are different and both identified objects so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// must not alias.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a863ee317b92588eb2d6878af9fc98922">AliasResult::NoAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="744"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns true if the load or store can be analyzed. Atomic and volatile</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operations have properties which this analysis does not understand.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750" lineLink="#a13ace390c34c56c32bff6c20c4e7c6b5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a13ace390c34c56c32bff6c20c4e7c6b5">isLoadOrStore</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42;LI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LI-&gt;isUnordered();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/storeinst">StoreInst</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;StoreInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>-&gt;isUnordered();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Examines the loop nesting of the Src and Dst</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions and establishes their shared loops. Sets the variables</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CommonLevels, SrcLevels, and MaxLevels.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The source and destination instructions needn&#39;t be contained in the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop. The routine establishNestingLevels finds the level of most deeply</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// nested loop that contains them both, CommonLevels. An instruction that&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// not contained in a loop is at level = 0 MaxLevels is equal to the level</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the source plus the level of the destination, minus CommonLevels.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This lets us allocate vectors MaxLevels in length, with room for every</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// distinct loop referenced in both the source and destination subscripts.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The variable SrcLevels is the nesting depth of the source instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s used to help calculate distinct loops referenced by the destination.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here&#39;s the map from loops to levels:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            0 - unused</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            1 - outermost common loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          ... - other common loops</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CommonLevels - innermost common loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          ... - loops containing Src but not Dst</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    SrcLevels - innermost loop containing Src but not Dst</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          ... - loops containing Dst but not Src</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    MaxLevels - innermost loops containing Dst but not Src</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Consider the follow code fragment:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   for (a = ...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     for (b = ...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       for (c = ...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         for (d = ...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           A&#91;&#93; = ...;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       for (e = ...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         for (f = ...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           for (g = ...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             ... = A&#91;&#93;;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we&#39;re looking at the possibility of a dependence between the store</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to A (the Src) and the load from A (the Dst), we&#39;ll note that they</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have 2 loops in common, so CommonLevels will equal 2 and the direction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vector for Result will have 2 entries. SrcLevels = 4 and MaxLevels = 7</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A map from loop names to loop numbers would look like</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     a - 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     b - 2 = CommonLevels</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     c - 3</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     d - 4 = SrcLevels</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     e - 5</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     f - 6</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     g - 7 = MaxLevels</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::establishNestingLevels(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;Src,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="normal">                                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;Dst) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a8472e46f9e4db168c5610ecdfb05dbaf">BasicBlock</a> &#42;SrcBlock = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-linkmodules-cpp-/#ab56eb2027bc9c069aa696e54de8b4298a276e79316561733d64abdf00f8e8ae48">Src</a>-&gt;getParent();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a8472e46f9e4db168c5610ecdfb05dbaf">BasicBlock</a> &#42;DstBlock = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-linkmodules-cpp-/#ab56eb2027bc9c069aa696e54de8b4298a1448a68418666ed85e07646744af82ef">Dst</a>-&gt;getParent();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SrcLevel = LI-&gt;getLoopDepth(SrcBlock);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DstLevel = LI-&gt;getLoopDepth(DstBlock);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;SrcLoop = LI-&gt;getLoopFor(SrcBlock);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;DstLoop = LI-&gt;getLoopFor(DstBlock);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="normal">  SrcLevels = SrcLevel;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="normal">  MaxLevels = SrcLevel + DstLevel;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SrcLevel &gt; DstLevel) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="normal">    SrcLoop = SrcLoop-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#ae34bcd53f75fab0c03b509ecccb4cfaf">getParentLoop</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="normal">    SrcLevel--;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DstLevel &gt; SrcLevel) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="normal">    DstLoop = DstLoop-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#ae34bcd53f75fab0c03b509ecccb4cfaf">getParentLoop</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="normal">    DstLevel--;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SrcLoop != DstLoop) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="normal">    SrcLoop = SrcLoop-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#ae34bcd53f75fab0c03b509ecccb4cfaf">getParentLoop</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="normal">    DstLoop = DstLoop-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#ae34bcd53f75fab0c03b509ecccb4cfaf">getParentLoop</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="normal">    SrcLevel--;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="normal">  CommonLevels = SrcLevel;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="normal">  MaxLevels -= CommonLevels;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given one of the loops containing the source, return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// its level index in our numbering scheme.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::mapSrcLoop(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;SrcLoop)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SrcLoop-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a57994482c17097d9f936acff3a6598ac">getLoopDepth</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given one of the loops containing the destination,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// return its level index in our numbering scheme.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::mapDstLoop(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;DstLoop)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a> = DstLoop-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a57994482c17097d9f936acff3a6598ac">getLoopDepth</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a> &gt; CommonLevels)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This tries to make sure that we assign unique numbers to src and dst when</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the memory accesses reside in different loops that have the same depth.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a> - CommonLevels + SrcLevels;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the ZIV test. Basically, we test by comparing the two values,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but there are actually three possible results:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) the values are equal, so there&#39;s a dependence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) the values are different, so there&#39;s no dependence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3) the values might be equal, so we have to assume a dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if dependence disproved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::testZIV(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Src, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Dst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><Highlight kind="normal">                             FullDependence &amp;Result)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;    src = &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; &#42;Src &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// strongSIVtest -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// From the paper, Practical Dependence Testing, Section 4.2.1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we have a pair of subscripts of the form &#91;c1 + a&#42;i&#93; and &#91;c2 + a&#42;i&#93;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where i is an induction variable, c1 and c2 are loop invariant,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  and a is a constant, we can solve it exactly using the Strong SIV test.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1209"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1210"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Can prove independence. Failing that, can compute distance (and direction).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1211"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In the presence of symbolic terms, we can sometimes make progress.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1212"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1213"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If there&#39;s a dependence,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1214"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1215"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    c1 + a&#42;i = c2 + a&#42;i&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1216"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1217"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The dependence distance is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1218"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1219"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    d = i&#39; - i = (c1 - c2)/a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1220"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1221"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A dependence only exists if d is an integer and abs(d) &lt;= U, where U is the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1222"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop&#39;s upper bound. If a dependence exists, the dependence direction is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1223"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// defined as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1224"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1225"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                &#123; &lt; if d &gt; 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1226"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    direction = &#123; = if d = 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1227"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                &#123; &gt; if d &lt; 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1228"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1229"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if dependence disproved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1230"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::strongSIVtest(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Coeff, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;SrcConst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1231"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;DstConst, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;CurLoop,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1337"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1338"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// weakCrossingSIVtest -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1339"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// From the paper, Practical Dependence Testing, Section 4.2.2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1340"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1341"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we have a pair of subscripts of the form &#91;c1 + a&#42;i&#93; and &#91;c2 - a&#42;i&#93;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1342"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where i is an induction variable, c1 and c2 are loop invariant,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1343"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and a is a constant, we can solve it exactly using the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1344"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Weak-Crossing SIV test.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1345"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1346"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given c1 + a&#42;i = c2 - a&#42;i&#39;, we can look for the intersection of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1347"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the two lines, where i = i&#39;, yielding</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1348"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1349"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    c1 + a&#42;i = c2 - a&#42;i</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1350"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    2a&#42;i = c2 - c1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1351"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    i = (c2 - c1)/2a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1352"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1353"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i &lt; 0, there is no dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1354"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i &gt; upperbound, there is no dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1355"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i = 0 (i.e., if c1 = c2), there&#39;s a dependence with distance = 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1356"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i = upperbound, there&#39;s a dependence with distance = 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1357"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i is integral, there&#39;s a dependence (all directions).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1358"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the non-integer part = 1/2, there&#39;s a dependence (&lt;&gt; directions).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1359"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, there&#39;s no dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1361"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Can prove independence. Failing that,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1362"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can sometimes refine the directions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1363"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Can determine iteration for splitting.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1364"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1365"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if dependence disproved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1366"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::weakCrossingSIVtest(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1367"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Coeff, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;SrcConst, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;DstConst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1368"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;CurLoop, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Level, FullDependence &amp;Result,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1548"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we have a pair of subscripts of the form &#91;c1 + a1&#42;i&#93; and &#91;c2 + a2&#42;i&#93;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1549"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where i is an induction variable, c1 and c2 are loop invariant, and a1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1550"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and a2 are constant, we can solve it exactly using an algorithm developed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1551"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// by Banerjee and Wolfe. See Algorithm 6.2.1 (case 2.5) in:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1552"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1553"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        Dependence Analysis for Supercomputing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1554"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        Utpal Banerjee</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1555"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        Kluwer Academic Publishers, 1988</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1556"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1557"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s slower than the specialized tests (strong SIV, weak-zero SIV, etc),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1725"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1726"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1727"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1728"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// weakZeroSrcSIVtest -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1729"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// From the paper, Practical Dependence Testing, Section 4.2.2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1730"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1731"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we have a pair of subscripts of the form &#91;c1&#93; and &#91;c2 + a&#42;i&#93;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1732"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where i is an induction variable, c1 and c2 are loop invariant,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1733"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and a is a constant, we can solve it exactly using the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1734"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Weak-Zero SIV test.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1735"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1736"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1737"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1738"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    c1 = c2 + a&#42;i</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1739"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1740"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we get</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1741"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1742"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    (c1 - c2)/a = i</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1743"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1744"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i is not an integer, there&#39;s no dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1745"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i &lt; 0 or &gt; UB, there&#39;s no dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1746"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i = 0, the direction is &gt;= and peeling the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1747"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1st iteration will break the dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1748"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i = UB, the direction is &lt;= and peeling the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1749"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// last iteration will break the dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1750"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, the direction is &#42;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1751"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1752"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Can prove independence. Failing that, we can sometimes refine</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1753"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the directions. Can sometimes show that first or last</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// iteration carries all the dependences (so worth peeling).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1756"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (see also weakZeroDstSIVtest)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1757"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1758"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if dependence disproved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1759"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::weakZeroSrcSIVtest(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;DstCoeff,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1760"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;SrcConst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1761"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;DstConst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1762"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;CurLoop, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Level,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1765"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For the WeakSIV test, it&#39;s possible the loop isn&#39;t common to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1766"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the Src and Dst loops. If it isn&#39;t, then there&#39;s no need to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1836"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1837"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1838"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// weakZeroDstSIVtest -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1839"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// From the paper, Practical Dependence Testing, Section 4.2.2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1840"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1841"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we have a pair of subscripts of the form &#91;c1 + a&#42;i&#93; and &#91;c2&#93;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1842"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where i is an induction variable, c1 and c2 are loop invariant,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1843"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and a is a constant, we can solve it exactly using the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1844"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Weak-Zero SIV test.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1845"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1846"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1847"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1848"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    c1 + a&#42;i = c2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1849"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1850"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we get</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1851"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1852"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    i = (c2 - c1)/a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1853"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1854"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i is not an integer, there&#39;s no dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1855"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i &lt; 0 or &gt; UB, there&#39;s no dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1856"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i = 0, the direction is &lt;= and peeling the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1857"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1st iteration will break the dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1858"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If i = UB, the direction is &gt;= and peeling the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1859"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// last iteration will break the dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1860"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, the direction is &#42;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1861"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1862"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Can prove independence. Failing that, we can sometimes refine</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1863"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the directions. Can sometimes show that first or last</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1864"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// iteration carries all the dependences (so worth peeling).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1865"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1866"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (see also weakZeroSrcSIVtest)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1867"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1868"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if dependence disproved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1869"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::weakZeroDstSIVtest(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;SrcCoeff,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1870"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;SrcConst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1871"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;DstConst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1872"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;CurLoop, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Level,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1875"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For the WeakSIV test, it&#39;s possible the loop isn&#39;t common to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1876"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Src and Dst loops. If it isn&#39;t, then there&#39;s no need to record a direction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
