<Link id="l02066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2066"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2067"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2068"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2069"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// symbolicRDIVtest -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2070"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In Section 4.5 of the Practical Dependence Testing paper,the authors</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2071"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// introduce a special case of Banerjee&#39;s Inequalities (also called the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2072"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Extreme-Value Test) that can handle some of the SIV and RDIV cases,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2073"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// particularly cases with symbolics. Since it&#39;s only able to disprove</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2074"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dependence (not compute distances or directions), we&#39;ll use it as a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2075"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fall back for the other tests.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2076"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2077"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we have a pair of subscripts of the form &#91;c1 + a1&#42;i&#93; and &#91;c2 + a2&#42;j&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2078"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where i and j are induction variables and c1 and c2 are loop invariants,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2079"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we can use the symbolic tests to disprove some dependences, serving as a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2080"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// backup for the RDIV test. Note that i and j can be the same variable,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2081"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// letting this test serve as a backup for the various SIV tests.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2082"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2083"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For a dependence to exist, c1 + a1&#42;i must equal c2 + a2&#42;j for some</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2084"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  0 &lt;= i &lt;= N1 and some 0 &lt;= j &lt;= N2, where N1 and N2 are the (normalized)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2085"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop bounds for the i and j loops, respectively. So, ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2086"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2087"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// c1 + a1&#42;i = c2 + a2&#42;j</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2088"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a1&#42;i - a2&#42;j = c2 - c1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2089"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2090"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To test for a dependence, we compute c2 - c1 and make sure it&#39;s in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2091"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// range of the maximum and minimum possible values of a1&#42;i - a2&#42;j.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2092"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Considering the signs of a1 and a2, we have 4 possible cases:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2093"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2094"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) If a1 &gt;= 0 and a2 &gt;= 0, then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2095"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        a1&#42;0 - a2&#42;N2 &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;= a1&#42;N1 - a2&#42;0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2096"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//              -a2&#42;N2 &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;= a1&#42;N1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2097"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2098"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) If a1 &gt;= 0 and a2 &lt;= 0, then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2099"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        a1&#42;0 - a2&#42;0 &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;= a1&#42;N1 - a2&#42;N2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  0 &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;= a1&#42;N1 - a2&#42;N2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3) If a1 &lt;= 0 and a2 &gt;= 0, then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        a1&#42;N1 - a2&#42;N2 &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;= a1&#42;0 - a2&#42;0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        a1&#42;N1 - a2&#42;N2 &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;= 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2105"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2106"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 4) If a1 &lt;= 0 and a2 &lt;= 0, then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        a1&#42;N1 - a2&#42;0  &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;= a1&#42;0 - a2&#42;N2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        a1&#42;N1         &lt;= c2 - c1 &lt;=       -a2&#42;N2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2109"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2110"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// return true if dependence disproved</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::symbolicRDIVtest(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;A1, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;A2,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2112"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;C1, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;C2,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2113"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;Loop1,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2114"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;Loop2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2115"><Highlight kind="normal">  ++SymbolicRDIVapplications;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2116"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;\\ttry symbolic RDIV test\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2290"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// With minor algebra, this test can also be used for things like</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2385"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// gcdMIVtest -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2386"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Tests an MIV subscript pair for dependence.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2387"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns true if any possible dependence is disproved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2388"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Marks the result as inconsistent.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2389"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Can sometimes disprove the equal direction for 1 or more loops,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2390"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as discussed in Michael Wolfe&#39;s book,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2391"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// High Performance Compilers for Parallel Computing, page 235</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2392"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2393"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We spend some effort (code!) to handle cases like</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2394"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;10&#42;i + 5&#42;N&#42;j + 15&#42;M + 6&#93;, where i and j are induction variables,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2395"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but M and N are just loop-invariant variables.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2396"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This should help us handle linearized subscripts;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2397"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// also makes this test a useful backup to the various SIV tests.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2398"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2399"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It occurs to me that the presence of loop-invariant variables</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2400"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// changes the nature of the test from &quot;greatest common divisor&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2401"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to &quot;a common divisor&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2402"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::gcdMIVtest(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Src, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Dst,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2571"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2572"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// banerjeeMIVtest -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2573"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Use Banerjee&#39;s Inequalities to test an MIV subscript pair.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2574"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (Wolfe, in the race-car book, calls this the Extreme Value Test.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2575"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Generally follows the discussion in Section 2.5.2 of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2576"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2577"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    Optimizing Supercompilers for Supercomputers</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2578"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    Michael Wolfe</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2579"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2580"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The inequalities given on page 25 are simplified in that loops are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2581"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// normalized so that the lower bound is always 0 and the stride is always 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2582"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example, Wolfe gives</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2583"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2584"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     LB^&lt;&#95;k = (A^-&#95;k - B&#95;k)^- (U&#95;k - L&#95;k - N&#95;k) + (A&#95;k - B&#95;k)L&#95;k - B&#95;k N&#95;k</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2585"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2586"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where A&#95;k is the coefficient of the kth index in the source subscript,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2587"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// B&#95;k is the coefficient of the kth index in the destination subscript,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2588"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// U&#95;k is the upper bound of the kth index, L&#95;k is the lower bound of the Kth</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2589"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// index, and N&#95;k is the stride of the kth index. Since all loops are normalized</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2590"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// by the SCEV package, N&#95;k = 1 and L&#95;k = 0, allowing us to simplify the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2591"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// equation to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2592"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2593"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     LB^&lt;&#95;k = (A^-&#95;k - B&#95;k)^- (U&#95;k - 0 - 1) + (A&#95;k - B&#95;k)0 - B&#95;k 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2594"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            = (A^-&#95;k - B&#95;k)^- (U&#95;k - 1)  - B&#95;k</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2595"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2596"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Similar simplifications are possible for the other equations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2597"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2598"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we can&#39;t determine the number of iterations for a loop,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2599"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we use NULL as an indicator for the worst case, infinity.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2600"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When computing the upper bound, NULL denotes +inf;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2601"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for the lower bound, NULL denotes -inf.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2602"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2603"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if dependence disproved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2604"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DependenceInfo::banerjeeMIVtest(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Src, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Dst,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3685"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here&#39;s an example of how it works. Consider this code:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3692"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             A&#91;i&#93;&#91;j&#93;&#91;k&#93;&#91;m&#93; = ...;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3693"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             ... = A&#91;0&#93;&#91;j&#93;&#91;l&#93;&#91;i + j&#93;;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3694"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3695"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3696"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3697"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3698"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3699"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3700"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are 4 subscripts here:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3701"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    0 &#91;i&#93; and &#91;0&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3702"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    1 &#91;j&#93; and &#91;j&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3703"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    2 &#91;k&#93; and &#91;l&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3704"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    3 &#91;m&#93; and &#91;i + j&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3705"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3706"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We&#39;ve already classified each subscript pair as ZIV, SIV, etc.,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3707"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and collected all the loops mentioned by pair P in Pair&#91;P&#93;.Loops.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3708"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In addition, we&#39;ve initialized Pair&#91;P&#93;.GroupLoops to Pair&#91;P&#93;.Loops</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3709"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and set Pair&#91;P&#93;.Group = &#123;P&#125;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3710"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3711"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      Src Dst    Classification Loops  GroupLoops Group</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3712"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    0 &#91;i&#93; &#91;0&#93;         SIV       &#123;1&#125;      &#123;1&#125;        &#123;0&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3713"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    1 &#91;j&#93; &#91;j&#93;         SIV       &#123;2&#125;      &#123;2&#125;        &#123;1&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3714"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    2 &#91;k&#93; &#91;l&#93;         RDIV      &#123;3,4&#125;    &#123;3,4&#125;      &#123;2&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3715"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    3 &#91;m&#93; &#91;i + j&#93;     MIV       &#123;1,2,5&#125;  &#123;1,2,5&#125;    &#123;3&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3716"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3717"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For each subscript SI 0 .. 3, we consider each remaining subscript, SJ.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3718"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So, 0 is compared against 1, 2, and 3; 1 is compared against 2 and 3, etc.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3719"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3720"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We begin by comparing 0 and 1 The intersection of the GroupLoops is empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3721"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Next, 0 and 2 Again, the intersection of their GroupLoops is empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3722"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Next 0 and 3 The intersection of their GroupLoop = &#123;1&#125;, not empty,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3723"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so Pair&#91;3&#93;.Group = &#123;0,3&#125; and Done = false (that is, 0 will not be added</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3724"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to either Separable or Coupled).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3725"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3726"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Next, we consider 1 and 2 The intersection of the GroupLoops is empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3727"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Next, 1 and 3 The intersection of their GroupLoops = &#123;2&#125;, not empty,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3728"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so Pair&#91;3&#93;.Group = &#123;0, 1, 3&#125; and Done = false.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3729"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3730"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Next, we compare 2 against 3 The intersection of the GroupLoops is empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3731"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since Done remains true, we add 2 to the set of Separable pairs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3732"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3733"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Finally, we consider 3 There&#39;s nothing to compare it with,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3734"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so Done remains true and we add it to the Coupled set.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3735"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Pair&#91;3&#93;.Group = &#123;0, 1, 3&#125; and GroupLoops = &#123;1, 2, 5&#125;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3736"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3737"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In the end, we&#39;ve got 1 separable subscript and 1 coupled group.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3738"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a> = 0; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a> &lt; Pairs; ++<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3739"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.Classification == Subscript::NonLinear) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3740"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ignore these, but collect loops for later</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3741"><Highlight kind="normal">      ++NonlinearSubscriptPairs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3742"><Highlight kind="normal">      collectCommonLoops(Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.Src,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3743"><Highlight kind="normal">                         LI-&gt;getLoopFor(Src-&gt;getParent()),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3744"><Highlight kind="normal">                         Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.Loops);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3745"><Highlight kind="normal">      collectCommonLoops(Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.Dst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3746"><Highlight kind="normal">                         LI-&gt;getLoopFor(Dst-&gt;getParent()),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3747"><Highlight kind="normal">                         Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.Loops);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3748"><Highlight kind="normal">      Result.Consistent = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3749"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.Classification == Subscript::ZIV) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3750"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// always separable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3751"><Highlight kind="normal">      Separable.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallbitvector/#a18e2d7efe05987370dc6b5c54797fcf5">set</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3752"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3753"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3754"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SIV, RDIV, or MIV, so check for coupled group</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3755"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a233737223c9a3dba810df5b91bc91d1fabbb9957d8adae962b153273c16bce571">Done</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3756"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SJ = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a> + 1; SJ &lt; Pairs; ++SJ) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3757"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallbitvector">SmallBitVector</a> Intersection = Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.GroupLoops;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3758"><Highlight kind="normal">        Intersection &amp;= Pair&#91;SJ&#93;.GroupLoops;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3759"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Intersection.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallbitvector/#ab06e25d03b0091f03f2a25118933236b">any</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3761"><Highlight kind="normal">          Pair&#91;SJ&#93;.GroupLoops |= Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.GroupLoops;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3763"><Highlight kind="normal">          Pair&#91;SJ&#93;.Group |= Pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>&#93;.Group;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3765"><Highlight kind="normal">        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3766"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3952"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#ac5804672fc0850438d63caec770647f8">II</a> = 1; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#ac5804672fc0850438d63caec770647f8">II</a> &lt;= CommonLevels; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#ac5804672fc0850438d63caec770647f8">II</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3955"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3956"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3957"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3958"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3959"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3960"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On the other hand, if all directions are equal and there&#39;s no</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3972"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3973"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::make&#95;unique&lt;FullDependence&gt;(std::move(Result));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3974"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3975"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3976"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3977"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// getSplitIteration -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3978"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Rather than spend rarely-used space recording the splitting iteration</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3979"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// during the Weak-Crossing SIV test, we re-compute it on demand.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3980"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The re-computation is basically a repeat of the entire dependence test,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3981"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// though simplified since we know that the dependence exists.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3982"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s tedious, since we must go through all propagations, etc.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3983"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3984"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Care is required to keep this code up to date with respect to the routine</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3985"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// above, depends().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3986"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3987"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Generally, the dependence analyzer will be used to build</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3988"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a dependence graph for a function (basically a map from instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3989"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to dependences). Looking for cycles in the graph shows us loops</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3990"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that cannot be trivially vectorized/parallelized.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3991"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03992" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3992"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can try to improve the situation by examining all the dependences</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3993"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that make up the cycle, looking for ones we can break.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3994"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sometimes, peeling the first or last iteration of a loop will break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3995"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dependences, and we&#39;ve got flags for those possibilities.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3996"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sometimes, splitting a loop at some other iteration will do the trick,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3997"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and we&#39;ve got a flag for that case. Rather than waste the space to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03998" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3998"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// record the exact iteration (since we rarely know), we provide</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03999" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3999"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a method that calculates the iteration. It&#39;s a drag that it must work</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04000" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4000"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// from scratch, but wonderful in that it&#39;s possible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4001"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4002"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here&#39;s an example:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4003"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4004"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    for (i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4005"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        A&#91;i&#93; = ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4006"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        ... = A&#91;11 - i&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4007"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4008"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There&#39;s a loop-carried flow dependence from the store to the load,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4009"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// found by the weak-crossing SIV test. The dependence will have a flag,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4010"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// indicating that the dependence can be broken by splitting the loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4011"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Calling getSplitIteration will return 5</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4012"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Splitting the loop breaks the dependence, like so:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4013"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4014"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    for (i = 0; i &lt;= 5; i++)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4015"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        A&#91;i&#93; = ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4016"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        ... = A&#91;11 - i&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4017"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    for (i = 6; i &lt; 10; i++)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4018"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        A&#91;i&#93; = ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4019"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        ... = A&#91;11 - i&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4020"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
